predicate.note: Frames file for 'tilt' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 47.6, 45.4.

example.name: most intuitive usage
example.text: As surely as a seesaw tilts, falling interest rates force up the price of previously issued bonds.

example.name: all args
example.text: Mr. Black said he is ``pleased'' with the economy's recent performance, and doesn't see ``a lot of excesses out there that *trace* would tilt us into recession.''

example.name: ergative with description
example.text: Will he, if he wins, be in the thrall of the most liberal of his allies, who advocate such policies as rent control for commercial buildings, or will he tilt toward the real-estate interests that have funneled money into his campaign?
example.arg: the real-estate interests that have funneled money into his campaign
